sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The revoltex [sic]. A trage-comedy acted between the Hind and panther, and Religio laici, &c. Revolter Dryden, John, 1631-1700. Hind and panther. Selections. Dryden, John, 1631-1700. Religio laici. Selections.
[2], 32 p.
[s.n.], London : printed in the year 1687.
A satire on John Dryden, with extracts from his poems. In verse. Running title reads: The revolter. A trage-comedy. A variant, presumably later, has "Revolter" in place of "Revoltex" in line 2 of title. Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======

[2], 32 p.
[s.n.], London : printed in the year 1687.
A satire on John Dryden, with extracts from his poems. In verse. Running title reads: The revolter. A trage-comedy. A variant, presumably later, has "Revolter" in place of "Revoltex" in line 2 of title. Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
